intro: Parodia oxycostata subsp. gracilis, commonly known as the slender pincushion cactus, is a compact, globular cactus with a distinctive appearance. It features a sparsely branched stem that is typically pale green to blue-gray in color. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers during the warmer months. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soil with minimal water. Due to its slow growth and unique form, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
